WorkItem.Description:
When defining *EVERY* object in JS you add comma at the end of every property.
Why in the world, when defining interfaces is there a semicolon at the end?

It really doesn't make any sense!!
WorkItem.Summary: Why when declaring interfaces there is semicolon instead of comma?

Comments.Message: Because interfaces aren't objects, they're contracts. Contracts have nothing to do with actual objects.

And so always thinking which is which!
Why not simply support them both and make the parser smart enough realize it.
